guidance: Explain clearly which information does not match
Do not assume which information is correct
Ask the supplier to confirm the correct details
Request updated documentation if required
Explain that graphiteConnect does not support duplicate tax IDs or duplicate profiles, unless a branch is required
Inform the supplier that may be a duplicate profile exists
create a template with bullets to enter the possible duplicate profile in graphiteConnect (example: Legal name:____, DBA:_____ Tax ID:____, Admin users:____)
Ask the requester if the profile is duplicate or if they need to create a branch

bank_approval_pending.case_name: Bank approval pending and approver has access
guidance: First, determine whether the person you are replying to is the bank approver or another user.
If the user is NOT the approver:
- Explain that the bank approval must be completed by a second user.
- Clarify that the user who added the bank account cannot approve their own bank details.
- Ask them to share the name and email address of the approver (leave placeholders in the email).
If the user IS the approver:
- Ask them to log in using the email address that has access.
- Instruct them to complete the pending bank approval task.
Include an embedded link to the knowledge base article explaining how to complete the bank approval.
Keep the tone clear, professional, and supportive. Do not mention internal systems or internal reasoning.

bank_approval_pending_invitation_sent.case_name: Bank approval pending and invitation sent to supplier
guidance: Explain that bank approval must be completed by a second user with banking permissions
Clarify that the current user cannot approve their own bank details
Create blank space or placeholder in the email for the name and email of the approver
Explain that an invitation has been sent to the approver inbox or spam
Explain that the invitation creates login credentials for the approver
Clarify that the invitation comes from no-reply@graphiteconnect.com
Share an embedded link to the article how to complete the bank approval

bank_approval_no_second_user.case_name: There is no second user to approve
guidance: Explain that bank approval must be completed by a second user with banking permissions
Clarify that the current user cannot approve their own bank details
Explain how to add a second user
Request to set up banking permissions for the second user
Provide step by step instructions on how the second user can approve the bank details
Reference the article in the knowledge base using an embedded link

bank_update.case_name: There is no second user to approve
guidance: Explain in bullet points how to update the bank account section
Share an embedded link to the bank account update article
Explain that the supplier has added the bank account
Explain that the supplier has not shared the bank account with the customer
Create steps for supplier to share the bank account in the Connection profile view
Clarify that after the bank account is shared, the customer will have visibility of the bank account as normal

validation_bank_invalid_document.case_name: The document provided is not valid
guidance: Explain that the customer requires a valid bank document issued by the bank
Explain that customer cannot process invoices with a non valid bank document
Share the steps on how to upload a new bank document
Empathize with the requester
Explain that there is a validation hold
If the validation team message is provided, then explain the validation team message to the supplier
Clarify that as soon as the supplier makes the update, the validation team at graphiteConnect will check the information within 24 business hours
Clarify that we can help reset the 2FA method
Explain that a personal verification is needed when resetting the 2FA
Ask for the user's full name and email address who will complete the verification
Request the supplier to wait until we send a QR code/Link for verification
Empathize with the supplier
Explain why is it important to complete the verification process
Offer a manual verification over a video call
Clarify that manual verification requires the supplier to only share an ID card over the camera
Ask the supplier to book a video call with the calendly link https://calendly.com/graphiteconnect-angello-ruiz-landauro/angello-ruiz
Empathize with the supplier
If the supplier has not opt out of the verification process yet, instruct the supplier how to opt out in graphiteConnect
if the supplier has already opted out of the verification, explain the supplier that you will escalate this case with the customer
Empathize with the supplier
Explain how to complete the verification process successfully
share an embedded link from the knowledge base article: Enhanced Security: Identity Verification on Graphite
Ask the supplier to try again following

task_completed.case_name: The task was completed but not cleared out
guidance: Acknoledge the issue
Explain the task was completed, but not cleared out
Confirmed that I have already cleared out the task
Explain that there are outstanding tasks in graphiteConnect
Share the steps on how to complete tasks
Reference the article: Accepting an invitation from your customer (the section - complete required questions)
Explain that only users with user admin permissions can add other users
If the admin user contact details are provided, then share the admin details with the requester
Share an embedded link Adding new users from the knowledge base articles
Share an embedded link Roles & Permissions from the knowledge base articles
Explain that there is a final Review and Submit task
Explain the certify and review task from the knowledge base article
Provide detail steps on how to complete the Review and Submit task
Provide a link to the knowledge base article
If the Accepting an invitation from your customer article is provided, reference the section Certify your data and Accept the Invitation
Acknoledge the issue
Share the steps on how to reset the password
Explain that the password reset will work successfully if the email address exists in graphiteConnect records
share an embeded link from the knowledge base articles How to Update Your Password
Explain that the W9 form should be version March 2024 or later
Confirm that the current W9 form is an outdated version
Ask the vendor to upload an updated W9 form
Share the W9 document pdf link
Explain line one of the W9 form is for the company name
Explain that only if supplier has a DBA, should be enter in line 2
Explain that the EIN should be provided
Explain that the document must be dated and signed
Do not explain all the rules before only the necessary according to the problem_description input
Ask the vendor to upload an updated W9 form
Be polite
If the issue is solved, then explain that the issue was been solved
If customer has a pending task, clarify that the customer is currently working on that

If the status is review and there is no holds, clarify that there is no further action on the supplier's end and the graphiteConnect validation team will check the information within 24 business hours
If the status is review and has holds or issues, explain the needed update or next steps for the supplier
Empathize with the requester
Share my calendly link https://calendly.com/graphiteconnect-angello-ruiz-landauro/angello-ruiz
Explain that the calendly link will show my availability and allow to schedule a video call
Ask the requester to confirm as soon as they schedule the video call
If the customer contact is under the customer information section, then know the customer is in the email thread
Clarify that we would need confirmation from the customer before deleting the profile
If the supplier company name and graphite ID are provided in the Supplier information section, then:
Write the supplier company name and graphite ID in the email
Else: leave a placeholder or blank space in the email to enter the supplier legal name and graphite ID
If we know the customer email address, then:
- Confirm with the customer if there are pending invoices for the supplier
- Explain the customer that they should disconnect the supplier if there are no pending invoices
If we don't know the customer email or contact details, then ask the supplier to wait because we will need to contact the customer to remove the profile
Explain that user with user admin permissions can delete or remove other users
If the admin users contact details are provided in the supplier information section, then share the admin name and email
Share the steps in bullet points on how the admin user can remove users from the admin page
Explain that customers can delete invitation
Share the steps on how to delete de invitation in bullet points
Share an embedded link of the article How to cancel (delete) an invitation
Share the steps on how to edit sections in the connection view
Give an embedded link of the article How to Update Information When My Status is Connected
Explain that the admin user can grant permissions to other users from the admin page
Share an embedded link of the article Adding new users and refer the section Editing user permissions
Share an embedded link fo the article
Share steps on bullet points on how to edit the invite recipient
Share an embedded link of the article
If the invitation has been resent to the supplier, then:
- Ask the supplier to check the spam folder for an invite from no-reply@graphiteconnect.com
If the supplier is in the email thread, then, explain the supplier that there is a pending invitation to register the supplier company in graphiteConnect
Share an embedded link to the article Accepting an Invitation from your Customer

If the invitation has been resent, then prompt the supplier to accept the invitation again and share basic troubleshooting steps (example: clear cookies and caches, copy and paste the invitation link in an incognito windows, use google chrome as the preferred browser, etc)
If the customer ask to update a non-network profile, then explain politely that they should contact their internal team since non-network suppliers are fully onboarded by the customers
Explain how to set up a disregarded entity
Share an embedded link of the article Guideline for Disregarded Entities in Graphite
